posts.title: #OwnVoices Ramadan Books for Teens and Kids
posts.text: To help our patrons with their Ramadan celebrations at home or physically and socially distant gatherings, here is a selection of fifteen fiction and nonfiction print books, e-books, and electronic audiobooks by #OwnVoices Muslim authors.

posts.title: Handling Death & Pandemic Loss: 25 Books To Help Tweens, Teens & Adults Cope With Grief
posts.text: Novels and nonfiction books for all ages to help during the bereavement and grieving process.

posts.title: Chinese New Year Books | 農曆新年書籍  | 农历新年书籍
posts.text: 紐約公共圖書館在這裡為各個年齡段的讀者提供可以在保持社交距離下而進行的其他選擇 - 一些有關過年的圖畫書和食譜書單，我們圖書館和其他紐約市藝術組織提供的一些免費網上活動。

posts.title: Books and Virtual Library Events to Ring in the Year of the Ox/Bull/Cow | 新年快樂 | 새해 복 많이 받으세요 | Chúc Mừng Năm Mới
posts.text: To celebrate Lunar New Year we have put together a list of 36 holiday-related picture books novels, comics, craft books and cookbooks as well as compiled a list of free virtual events hosted by the Library and other New York City organizations.

posts.title: Black History STEAM Book List for Kids, Teens & Adults
posts.text: This list of over 100 books celebrates notable achievements by Black people in science, technology engineering, the arts, math and medicine.

posts.title: Walking In A Winter Movie Wonderland: Christmas Films for Adults
posts.text: In these quarantine times, seeing a movie at home might be one of the safest celebration options. Season's greetings and happy home viewing!

posts.title: Feliz Navidad & Joyeux Noël: Celebrate Christmas with World Music
posts.text: Ring in the holidays with festive world music albums in Spanish, French, Arabic, Chinese, Greek and Vietnamese.

posts.title: Come On And Jingle Bell Rock to These Holiday Albums
posts.text: Whether you prefer to celebrate Christmas with Tony Bennett, Nat King Cole, Justin Bieber, Kacey Musgraves, Sharon Jones & The Dap Kings, or Charlie Brown and friends, feel free to peruse the 40 album suggestions listed below.

posts.title: It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year...for Family-Friendly Holiday Films and Books
posts.text: Celebrate the holidays with a film or television show from the comforts of your couch with these 22 holiday specials to borrow from the New York Public Library.

posts.title: Celebrate Diwali: Books, Educational Resources & Virtual Events about the Festival of Lights
posts.text: Diwali is one of the most important Hindu holidays and is also celebrated by Sikhs, Jains and some Buddhists. Here's a suggested list of print books and e-books for children and other resources to help your family celebrate or learn more about this "festival of lights."

posts.title: Books to Celebrate the Mid Autumn Festival: 家人，朋友和月餅：慶祝中秋佳節的書籍  / 家人 | 朋友和月饼：庆祝中秋佳节的书籍
posts.text: 這個節日是傳統的豐收慶祝活動，全世界華人，韓國人，日本人和越南人世代相傳。

posts.title: Family, Friends and Mooncakes: Books to Celebrate the Mid Autumn Festival | 家人，朋友和月餅：慶祝中秋佳節的書籍 | 가족, 친구, 송편: 추석을 기념하는 책 |  家族、友達、団子：月見を祝う本
posts.text: A selection of children's picture books, e-books and teen comics to help families celebrate the Mid-Autumn Festival and learn more about the mythology, folklore and symbolism behind the holiday.

posts.title: Reading Beyond Chinatown: Books from the Chinese Diaspora
posts.text: A collection of titles that encompasses a wide range of narratives and genres spanning the global Chinese diaspora experience.

posts.title: Asian Pacific American Heritage Month: Researching with NYPL's E-Resources and Other Databases
posts.text: Including genealogy, the performing arts, LGBT studies and more.

posts.title: Virtual Events, E-Books & Websites to Expand Your Eco-Knowledge
posts.text: You can honor Earth Day and Arbor Day Every Day.

posts.title: Workout for One: Digital Fitness Videos You Can Do at Home
posts.text: Learn a new skill or get a basic refresher course that will get your body active and moving.

posts.title: Books and Library Events to Ring in the Year of the Mouse/Rat | 新年快樂 | 새해 복 많이 받으세요 | Chúc Mừng Năm Mới
posts.text: It's almost time to celebrate the Lunar New Year.

posts.title: Reading Stories That Define #OwnVoices: 20 Asian Pacific American Picture Books and Children's Comics
posts.text: This recommended reading list includes classic and recent pictures books, and comics created mostly by Asian Pacific American authors and illustrators - great for young readers ranging from babies and toddlers to elementary school students.

posts.title: Time to Dress Up: Introducing the NYPL Grow Up Work Fashion Library
posts.text: If you're looking to get dressed up for a job interview, wedding, or other formal event, the Riverside Library can help.

posts.title: Drawing Outside the Lines and Stereotypes: Six Amazing Asian American Graphic Novels
posts.text: Here are an outstanding half-dozen graphic novels for teens and tweens, written by Asian American authors and featuring Asian American protagonists. Think less about superhero powers and more about down-to-earth transformative tales.

posts.title: Sketch of Life: Children’s Biographies of Noteworthy Asian Pacific Americans
posts.text: Inspirational biographies never go out of style. As part of Asian Pacific American Heritage Month, kids can learn more about eight notable people who defied racism and made their mark in the arts, film, sports, and more.

posts.title: Happy Lunar New Year: Books and Events to Honor the Year of the Dog | 新年快樂  | 새해 복 많이 받으세요 | Chúc Mừng Năm Mới
posts.text: Begin celebrating The Year of the Dog with a selection of books, recordings, and Library events to suit all ages.

posts.title: Blessed Ramadan, Blessed Eid: Books for Children and Teens for the Holy Month / Ramadan Mubarak, Eid Mubarak /رمضان مبارك ، عيد مبارك: كتب للمراهقين والأطفال عن الشهر الكريم  / আশীর্বাদে রমাদান, আশীর্বাদ ঈদ / مبارک رمضان عید مبارک
posts.text: The New York Public Library has several picture books, non-fiction books and e-books for children and a few titles for teens observing or wish to learn more about Ramadan and Eid al-Fitr.

posts.title: Great Graphic Books for Tweens, Teens & Adults to be “Green”
posts.text: Environmental thinking should go beyond Earth Day. One holiday a year isn't enough time to celebrate the beauty of nature, help improve the planet or find out more about climate change and other environmental issues.

posts.title: Time to Grieve: Books for Children and Families Coping with Death and Dying
posts.text: These ten suggested novels—fiction and nonfiction—can assist families in starting that conversation, help children sort out their feelings, and ease the grieving process.

posts.title: “Bad Girls” Challenge the World: Five Biography and Essay Collections for Feminists
posts.text: Check out this list of books filled with profiles of notable women and an essay compilation on the current multifaceted feminist scene.

posts.title: 15 Books and Films To Mend a Broken Heart
posts.text: Check out this list of books and films that remind readers and viewers that love can be complicated, and they are not alone in experiencing relationship frustrations.

posts.title: 10 Great Picture Books about Diverse Children and Families
posts.text: Here are some picture books that can help children appreciate and understand how people and families can be different, and, at the same time, share the same universal value: love.

posts.title: Celebrate Lunar New Year with Library Books and Events
posts.text: While each culture, country and religion honors the holiday with unique customs and traditions, the Lunar New Year generally is a special time for people to gather for family reunions, wear new clothes, feast on special foods, visit temples/churches, and celebrate with music and dancing.
